sections.heading: This Act may be cited as the Cook County Circuit Apportionment Act of 1991.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Cook County Circuit Apportionment Act of 1991.

sections.heading: The Judicial Circuit of Cook County is divided into 15
(a) All counties, townships, census tracts, block groups, and
sections.text:
blocks are those that appear on maps published by the United States Bureau
of the Census for the 1990 census. The term "tract(s)" shall mean census
tract(s). All judicial subcircuits created by
this Act for the purpose of electing judges shall not be altered by
operation of any other statute, ordinance, or resolution.

sections.heading: This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
